info.title: Electronic Settlement Matching (eSM)
info.description:
Open API for the EFET eSM specification.

For details about the specification, see:
<http://www.cpml.org/specification/V5R0/CpML_V5R3_25102014.pdf> and <https://www.efet.org/Files/Standardisation/EFET%20eSM%20v2_1.pdf>

get.summary: Retrieve all Invoices and Shadow Documents

parameters.name: pageSize
parameters.description: How many items to return per page (max 100)

200.description: A paged array of Invoices and Shadow Documents

post.summary: Submit an Invoice or Shadow Document

parameters.name: invoiceId
parameters.description: The ID of the Invoice or Shadow Document to retrieve

get.summary: Retrieve a specific Invoice or Shadow Document

delete.summary: Cancel an Invoice or Shadow Document. Existing invoice must be in non-terminal state: Pending, Unmatched, Mismatched

parameters.name: limit
parameters.description: How many items to return at one time (max 100)

200.description: A paged array of Netting Statements

parameters.name: nettingStatementId
parameters.description: The ID of the Netting Statement to retrieve

delete.summary: Cancel a Netting Statement. Existing Netting Statement must be in non-terminal state: Pending, Unmatched, Mismatched

parameters.name: matchId
parameters.description: The ID of the Invoice Match to retrieve

get.summary: Retrieve a specific Invoice Matching Statement

delete.summary: Cancel an Invoice Matching Statement. Existing statement cannot have an Accepted or Rejected status

parameters.name: matchId
parameters.description: The ID of the Invoice Match to accept or refuse

get.summary: Retrieve a specific Invoice Matching Statement Acceptance/Refusal Status

post.summary: Submit an Invoice Matching Statement Acceptance/Refusal Status
Submit a Netting Matching Statement (Equivalent to Match Result Suggestion from EFET eSM specification)

parameters.name: matchId
parameters.description: The ID of the Netting Matching Statement to retrieve

get.summary: Retrieve a specific Netting Matching Statement

delete.summary: Cancel a Netting Matching Statement. Existing statement cannot have an Accepted or Rejected status

parameters.name: matchId
parameters.description: The ID of the Netting Matching Statement to accept or refuse

get.summary: Retrieve a specific Netting Matching Statement Acceptance/Refusal Status

post.summary: Submit a Netting Matching Statement Acceptance/Refusal Status
Submit a document by file upload. Supports Invoices, Shadow Invoices, Netting Statements and Matching Statements

NextPage.description: A link to the next page of responses

NotFound.description: The specified resource was not found

Forbidden.description: Access token does not have the required scope

code.description: Internal system error code referencing the cause of the error

message.description: Text description of the cause of the error

ESMDocument.description:
At root level, an Invoice ESMDocument has the following sections:
  * ‘ProcessInformation’
  * ‘AggregationKeys’
  * ‘InvoiceData’ and, optionally, ‘LineItems’

NettingESMDocument.description:
At root level, a Netting ESMDocument has the following sections:
  * ‘ProcessInformation’
  * ‘AggregationKeys’
  * ‘NettingStatement’ and ‘NettingStatementLineItems’

ProcessInformation.description: Metadata describing information about the document and how it should be used

LineItemsIncluded.description: Indicates whether the invoice contains line items

AggregationKeys.description:
Aggregation Keys are fields that are used together as a composite key to indicate correlation between an invoice and a shadow invoice.

Matching is only conducted against customer and supplier documents that have the exact same values for all aggregation keys.

Only one document of a specific document type (e.g. Invoice or Shadow Invoice) is allowed to have the same aggregation keys.
If a second document is submitted with the same set of aggregation keys and document type, this is treated as an error.
A document may be canceled and another one submitted with the same set of aggregation keys.

items.description: Per master agreement, one ‘AgreemenDetails’ section must be provided.

Agreement.description:
Indicates the legal framework that determines general terms and conditions applicable to the traded instruments.
The master agreement specifically determines the settlement rules and conditions that apply to the transactions that make up the invoice.

Matching field.

MasterAgreementVersion.description:
Year of master agreement.

Matching field.

InvoiceData.description: Summary information about an invoice. Covers parties, amounts, volumes and key metadata fields.

SelfBilling.description: Indicates whether an invoice is part of a self-billing process.

RegulatoryWording.description: Information on the regulatory context of the invoice.

NettingStatement.description:
Netting statements show the netting calculation from the independent perspective of each counterparty
meaning that the Payer’s sales must be matched with the Payee’s purchases and vice versa.

RegulatoryWording.description: Information on the regulatory context of the netting statement.

LineItem.description:
Contains detailed information about each trade represented by the invoice. LineItem information is optional and
may or may not be used for matching of invoices and shadow invoices.
See the ProcessInformation/lineItemsIncluded and ProcessInformation/lineItemsMatching.

Description.description: Text description of a line item

LineItemDetails.description: Contains date and price information about a line item

NettingStatementLineItem.description: Contains detailed information about each invoice represented by the netting statement

VATRepresentative.description: Person/organisation acting as the supplier’s tax representative.

LegalName.description: Legal name identifying the supplier in a national or regional company register.

CompanyRegistryNumber.description: Number of the register where the supplier or customer is registered.

CompanyRegistryName.description: Name of the register where the supplier is registered.

CompanyRegistryCity.description: City of the register where the supplier is registered.

BranchInformation.description: Information about the specific supplier branch acting as the party in this invoice.

ServiceProvider.description: Name of the eSM service provider that is used by the supplier. Valid values are provided as eSM static data.

VATRepresentative.description: Person/organisation acting as the supplier’s tax representative.

LegalName.description: Legal name identifying the supplier in a national or regional company register.

CompanyRegistryNumber.description: Number of the register where the supplier is registered.

CompanyRegistryName.description: Name of the register where the supplier is registered.

CompanyRegistryCity.description: City of the register where the supplier is registered.

BranchInformation.description: Information about the specific supplier branch acting as the party in this invoice.

ServiceProvider.description: Name of the eSM service provider that is used by the supplier. Valid values are provided as eSM static data.

Customer.description: Identity information about the company on the buy side of the invoice.

LegalName.description: Legal name identifying the customer in a national or regional company register.

ServiceProvider.description: Name of the eSM service provider that is used by the customer. Valid values are provided as eSM static data.

NetAmountType.description: Transaction net amount of invoice or netting statement.

GrossAmountType.description: Transaction gross amount of invoice or netting statement.

LineItemDetails.description: Contains date and price information about a line item

ContactDetails.description: Contact details including name, phone number and email.

InvoiceVATDetails.description: Value Added Tax information for an invoice

ExciseTaxInformation.description: Indirect tax applied by the local government of the supplier to the specific commodity embedded in the invoice.

NettingVATDetails.description: Value Added Tax information for a netting statement

InvoiceMatchingStatement.description:
Document describing overall match status for an invoice and shadow invoice as well as detailed matching information about each Matching Field.

This is a structured document containing both customer and supplier values for matching fields and indicates a match status for each matching field (e.g. Matched, Mismatched).

For nested elements, the matching status rolls up to higher levels. For instance, if there is a LineItem quantity that is Mismatched,
this will cause the matching status in all parent elements to also be mismatched including the overall invoice.

The document is designed to provide a complete description of why invoices do not mismatch.

NettingMatchingStatement.description:
Document describing overall match status for a netting statement as well as detailed matching information about each Matching Field.

This is a structured document containing both customer and supplier values for matching fields and indicates a match status for each matching field (e.g. Matched, Mismatched).

For nested elements, the matching status rolls up to higher levels. For instance, if there is a NettingLineItem quantity that is Mismatched,
this will cause the matching status in all parent elements to also be mismatched including the overall Netting Statement.

The document is designed to provide a complete description of why netting statements do not mismatch.

MatchingInvoiceData.description: Describes matching information about invoice data

MatchingNettingStatement.description: Describes matching information about a netting statement

MatchingNetAmount.description: Describes matching information about net amount

MatchingGrossAmount.description: Describes matching information about gross amount

MatchingInvoiceVatDetails.description: Describes matching information about invoice VAT

MatchingNettingVatDetails.description: Descries matching information about netting VAT

MatchingNettingLineItemVatDetails.description: Describes matching information about line item VAT

MatchingInvoiceLineItem.description: Describes matching information about an invoice line item

MatchingNettingLineItem.description: Describes matching information about a netting line item

MatchingNettingLineItemGrossAmount.description: Describes matching information about line item gross amount

MatchingInvoiceLineItemDetails.description: Describes matching information about invoice line item details

MatchingMarketInformation.description: Describes matching information about market information

MatchingDate.description: Describes matching information about a date

MatchingCurrencyCode.description: Describes matching information about currency code

MatchingUnitOfMeasure.description: Describes matching information about volume units

MatchingPhysicalOrFinancial.description: Describes matching information about physical or financial field

MatchingTransactionType.description: Describes matching information about the type of transaction

MatchingAreaType.description: Describes matching information about area type

MatchingStatementStatus.description: Describes matching information about a matching statement

MatchStatusType.description: Indicates the status of matching for a particular document or field within a document

PhysicalOrFinancialType.description: Indicates the nature of the transactions that make up an invoice.

NatureOfPriceType.description:
Indicates whether the transaction has a positive or zero price or has a negative price.
Negative prices often require a specific treatment, both on the accounting and on the financial settlement side.

Matching field.

LineItemsMatchingType.description:
Indicates whether line items are always used for matching the invoice or only in case of a mismatch in the ‘InvoiceData’ section.
Occurrence:
  * If ‘LineItemsIncluded’ is set to “True”, then this field is mandatory.
  * If ‘LineItemsIncluded’ is set to “False”, then this field must be omitted.

SenderRoleType.description:
Indicates which party is sending the document: the official document issuer or the shadow document issuer.
In case of self-billing, the official document issuer is the customer, in other cases it is the supplier.

Values:
* If the ‘InvoiceData’ section is present, then the value “Official¬Document¬Issuer” or “Shadow-Document¬Issuer” must be used.
* If the ‘NettingStatement’ section is present, then the value “DocumentIssuer” or “ReverseDocumentIssuer” must be used.

FixedOrFloatingType.description: Price relation of the transactions that make up an invoice.

IdentificationType.description: A unique identier of the document

VersionType.description:
Version of the ESMDocument. The version number is always associated with the ‘DocumentID’.
It is used to distinguish and order the initial ESMDocument and all its amendments over time.
Important: ESMDocuments may only be amended for processing reasons, for examples, in case of transmission failures.
If the details of an invoice or netting statement change, a new ESMDocument with a different document ID must be sent.
The default value is 1.

SSDSIDType.description: String that combines a VAT ID with an EIC, separated by an underscore.

UsageType.description: Indicates whether the ESMDocument is a test message or a live message.

ESMCurrencyCodeType.description: ISO 4217 3 alpha code identifying a currency unit. Only uppercase letters are allowed.

VATIDType.description: String representing a VAT ID, a 2-letter country code followed by 2 to 12 numerical digits.

ESMIdentifierCodeType.description: Identifier code of the customer or supplier of an invoice, represented as EIC, LEI or ACER code.

TypeOfESMIdentifierCodeType.description: Type of code detailing the nature of the identifier code.

EnergyProductType.description:
Subject of the trading relationship, for example, referring to power (electricity), gas (natural gas), freight, time charter or renewables (CO2 certificates).

Matching field.

PhoneNumberType.description:
String representing an international phone number, starting with + and followed by numbers.
Zeros for local prefixes should not be indicated.
Special characters such as brackets, hyphens, blanks, or slashes are not allowed.

IBANType.description: String representing IBAN according to ISO 13616:2007

BICType.description: Text string representing a BIC, using 8 or 11 characters

QuantityType.description:
The number of occurrences of an object.
Positive quantities shall not have a sign. A quantity may be expressed up to 8 decimal places, dot-separated and with leading zeros suppressed.

FXCurrencyPairType.description: Two alphabetic currency codes according to ISO 4217, separated by a slash. Example: EUR/GBP

FXReferenceType.description: Link to officially published fixing value for the FX rate.

DateType.description:
Identification of a particular calendar day by its calendar year, its calendar month and its ordinal number within its calendar month.
The date shall respect ISO 8601 formatting extended format YYYY-MM-DD. Leading zeros shall be used.

TradeIDType.description: A company's internal identification code for a trade (from ETRM or similar system)

UTIType.description: Unique Trade Identifier (UTI) acting as unique reference for the transaction, shared between supplier and customer.

UnitOfMeasureType.description: Unit of measure in which the volume is expressed.

TransactionType.description:
Matching field.

Occurrence:
  * If PhysicalOrFinancial is set to “Physical”, then this field must be omitted.
  * If PhysicalOrFinancial is set to “Financial”, then this field is mandatory.
Values:
  * If the transaction is a fixed swap, then set this field to “FXD_SWP”.
  * If the transaction is a float swap, then set this field to “FLT_SWP”.

IndexNameType.description:
If ‘LineItem/TransactionType’ is set to “FXD_SWP” and this is the first ‘LineItemDetails’ section, then this field must be omitted.

Else, this field is optional.

Index name that is used if ISIN or standardized name exists, including its term. Examples: PHELIX19, ELIX22."

AreaType.description:
Location where the commodity is physically delivered.

Delivery locations are mostly defined by Energy Identification Codes (EIC), indicating the physical location on national or regional gas or electricity grids."

MarketInformationType.description:
String representing a country or pair of countries using 2-letter country codes
according to ISO 3166-1. If two countries are indicated, they are separated by a slash."
